snippet: Pauline Marois, the province’s separatist premier, dissolved its Legislature and said voters could choose a new one on April 7.
abstract: Pauline Marois, separatist premier of Quebec, calls a snap election less than 18 months after gaining a tenuous hold on power; says that she is dissolving the provincial legislative assembly and that voters would choose a new one.
lead_paragraph: Pauline Marois, the province’s separatist premier, dissolved its Legislature and said voters could choose a new one on April 7.

headline.main: Quebec’s Separatist Premier Calls a Snap Election for April
headline.print_headline: Quebec’s Separatist Premier Calls a Snap Election for April
